properties.name: A Quiet New Year's Eve
properties.description: Posted by BaostarMark and Karla invited us over for a night in at their beautiful home in Corona Del Mar. We ordered Domino pizzas, made our own tortilla chips with ceviche, brownies, and drank some really good champagne. I played a board game (LIFE) with Paris and Capri where we just, sort of, made up our own rules. Others joined in - Paris and I teamed up to be the two apostles of the bank. All the kids felt asleep on the couch before midnight... at midnight, we toasted Happy New Year!!! Karla offered for us to sleep over but we decided to head out into the "flower streets" where people are walking along the sidewalk merrily and drunk. And that was the end of 2006.

properties.name: A plethora of palm trees
properties.description: Posted by Baostar   I\'m not sure how many palm trees there are in the parking lot of the Irvine Marketplace - but look at them all!

properties.name: Bar Marmont
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  8171 W Sunset Blvd, West Hollywood, CA 90046-2415It\'s closed now - what a bummer. We came here to get drunk after Kiet\'s birthday dinner.

properties.name: Breakfast at Corner Bakery
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  13786 D Jamboree Rd #4, Irvine, CA 92602I usually don\'t wake up this early on the weekend, but here I am at the local Corner Bakery with Kim and Cynthia. The sun is glaring through the windows. Arghhh...

properties.name: Central Park
properties.description: Posted by Baostar   Northpark - Central ParkThis paseo run through the heart of the village where I live. It is lined with tall 60-years-old eucalyptus trees and serve as a nice place for a jog or walk. You can see the hills every steps of the way if you\'re walking north (opposite direction).

properties.name: Christmas Day, Finally
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  This was the fourth Christmas dinner I ate this holiday season. We spend the day singing "The Twelve Days of Christmas", opening many presents and playing with all the kids.

properties.name: Coronado Gardens
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  A poolside BBQ under a shady pergola at Coronado Gardens. You can lay back at look at the palm tree above, foothills in the background, and a little tower that faces the street.

properties.name: Croquet Game at San Marino Gardens
properties.description: Posted by Baostar   People playing croquet on a Sunday afternoon in my neighborhood. This is one of many small private parks where I live.

properties.name: Cupcake Love
properties.description: Posted by Baostar A small batch of my homemade pastel cupcakes that I gave to the girls next door. The frosting is a thick, almond-flavored sugar glaze much like that on a donut. The cake itself is made of powder sugar, butter, almond extract, honey and pecan.

properties.name: Dirty Blossom For The Broken Ground
properties.description: Posted by Baostar    I remember the rainy days in Tokyo when we first met - though Japan is quite beautiful in the springtime, especially when the sakuras bloom and blanket the ground like snow. I was wandering around Ueno Park, leaving the crowd of people and Hanami parties behind, when you tapped my shoulder and asked me to take a photo of you standing in front of a temple, on top of the hill. You spoke charmingly with a British accent, Chinese-born and living in London. You were amazingly backpacking through Japan on your own for a month. We shared stories of our trips, and then you showed a map of your adventure plans. We swapped emails and addresses. We took pictures of ourselves. When I got back home I received a postcard from you in Nagoya - and later, stories of a dodgy hotel in Osaka, the peril of riding bikes in Kyoto, among other life\'s off-kilter experiences. I sent winded emails of little things about me, hoping you\'ll get in touch with me when you get home, but somehow you didn\'t. Now it\'s springtime again and I\'m thinking of going to London. I want to give you a call when I do make it to the swanky shopping district of London - and hopefully, you\'ll remember me, still, after the long-distance spell. But my nerves are weak now and "all the umbrellas in London couldn\'t stop this rain."

properties.name: Easter Brunch at the Paz's
properties.description: Posted by Baostar   Dana Point, CAA wonderful Easter brunch and scavenger hunt with the kids. A tour of Dana Point harbor ensues, and it was quite beautiful.

properties.name: Edible Landscaping Lecture
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  2301 San Joaquin Hills Rd, Corona del Mar, California 92625Stumbled upon an edible landscaping lecture session at Roger\'s Garden today. Nursery manager Ron Vanderhoff and plant buyer Rex Yarwood will introduce the audience to many less familiar plants that are not only tasty but beautiful. Particular emphasis will be placed on blueberries for our local gardens. Some of the edible landscape plants discussed will likely include dwarf figs, tasty passion fruits, gourmet varieties of artichoke, grapes, berries, avocado and even caper plants and coffee trees and there may be a few surprises in store as well. Ron and Rex agree that although many of these California specialties are not popularly grown in local gardens, they should be. You will not only learn about delicious plants that you can grow, but you will learn how to use them in the landscape, their nutritional needs, water requirements and other care.

properties.name: Exodus
properties.description: Posted by Baostar Exodus (formerly) data center.

properties.name: Forest Ave
properties.description: Posted by Baostar

properties.name: Fountain at University Center
properties.description: Posted by Baostar 4101 Campus Drive, Irvine, CA 92612This fountain is located near the center of University Center. The cascading water has a slight bent to it and sensation of rain.

properties.name: Heisler Park Gazebo
properties.description: Posted by Atruschel  361 Cliff Drive, Laguna Beach, CA 92561

properties.name: Iris Fountain
properties.description: Posted by Baostar881 NEWPORT CENTER DR., NEWPORT BEACH, CA 92660-6943 This water fountain is called the "Iris Fountain", which is located near Haagen-Dazs at Fashion Island. You can see it from the food terrace above (as pictured). It is controlled by a computer that programs its jets of water, giving them distinctive patterns.

properties.name: Jamboree Exit (I-405)
properties.description: Posted by BaostarA regular sight of my commute when exiting on Jamboree.

properties.name: Livie on the arcade machine
properties.description: Posted by Baostar Aliso Viejo, CALivie taking her turn on the Magical Drop game. She looks very engaged with the colorful balls.

properties.name: Main Beach in Laguna at Night
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  Laguna Beach, CAThe S-shaped swirl of lights is Pacific Coast Highway.

properties.name: My commute in Irvine
properties.description: Posted by BaostarIrvine, CAThis is what my commute looks like when I worked a Cardservice. To the left is John Wayne Airport; turn right on Michelson Dr and you\'ll find a tiny, drive-thru coffee hut and a realm of office buildings.

properties.name: My commute to Aliso Viejo
properties.description: Posted by BaostarThis what my commute looks like when I worked at buy.com. It was a scenic drive down Pacific Coast Highway through Huntington Beach, Newport Beach, Laguna Beach, and Laguna Canyon everyday. This part of the stretch is where Emerald Bay is at - get a whiff of that ocean view to the right.

properties.name: One Good Summer
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  Fountain Valley, CAMy earliest memory as a child was swimming in public pools with my father. As I grew up, my friends and I would float at night in swimming pools the temperature of blood; pools the color of Earth as seen from outer space. We would spend our summer days and nights bathed in chlorine - lit by the pure blue lights installed underneath diving boards. I used to think that the heat would suck every last drop from your swimming pool or redden our skins until it had the hue of raw flesh. I remembered you saying... And some people like summer. "Have a great summer," their yearbook inscriptions bellow happily, as if they actually want me to enjoy myself, as if they actually would notice if I imploded in front of them. But with graduation here and the fact that I will probably never see any of my school mates again hovering in my brain, I can honestly say that I am going to have the best summer of my life and even my new manager at work can\'t stop me. So here\'s to you being able to fling your problems away like the fleas off a dog\'s back and by the way, have a great summer.

properties.name: Pacific Whey's Patio
properties.description: Posted by Baostar7962 Pacific Coast Highway, Newport Coast, CAA breezy, relaxing place where you get get wonderful breakfast, coffee and desserts. Directly above you are shady branches of olive trees; there are usually cuddly dogs sitting next to their owners; behind you is a long, steep stairway to unaffordable homes; stand up and you can see the Pacific Ocean.

properties.name: Poppy Avenue
properties.description: Posted by Baostar Poppy Ave, Corona del Mar, CA One of many flower streets in Corona Del Mar.

properties.name: Roses blooming on trellises at Roger's Gardens
properties.description: Posted by BaostarA sign of summer is the roses blooming on the two arch-shaped trellises at the back of Roger\'s Gardens.

properties.name: Sandcastles at Alamitos Bay
properties.description: Posted by Baostar This is where we strolled around after Thanksgiving dinner. The kids couldn\'t decide between making sandcastles and playing football on the beach. Boats with lights cruised around the bay with floating Christmas trees in the backdrop - thus, celebrating Christmas in true Southern California style.

properties.name: Sari fastlike
properties.description: Posted by BaostarLaguna Beach, CAEnjoying our dinner outside on the patio of Partner Bistro and watching people walking the back alley on Bourbon Street.

properties.name: Sausalito Gardens
properties.description: Posted by Baostar     Hanging out by the pool, eating home-made ice cream sandwiches and almond crostata, drinking soda pops, and talking about making 50 beignets later.

properties.name: Shed on Old Myford Road
properties.description: Posted by Baostar An old shed where Old Myford Road dead ends at Irvine Blvd appearing out of context with shopping mall across the street.

properties.name: Strawberry Cupcakes
properties.description: Posted by Baostar   Krista\'s strawberry cupcakes made like angel food cake with home-made whip cream and fresh strawberries. I\'m definitely a big fan of these. I want more.

properties.name: Strawberry Stand
properties.description: Posted by Baostar   Irvine Blvd & Marketplace, Irvine, CAI love to walk along the Peters Canyon wash trail along the 261 on Sunday afternoons on my way down to the strawberry stand on Irvine Boulevard. Furthermore, the Peters Canyon trail connects with the San Diego Creek trail that will lead you to Upper Newport Bay in Newport Beach - both trails are collectively known as \'Mountains to Sea Trail\'. It\'s nice living right next to it!

properties.name: Summer porch party
properties.description: Posted by Baostar    Hanging out in front porch of Matt and Jenn\'s place for Forrest\'s 13.

properties.name: Summit Park
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  Soaring 610 feet in elevation, this picturesque view is at Summit Park, which is located within the gated neighborhoods of The Summit at Turtle Ridge.

properties.name: The Carousel
properties.description: Posted by Baostar74 Fortune Drive, Irvine, CAThis carousel is 38 feet in diameter with 32 horses and menagerie animals created from original works by famous carousel maker Gustav Dentzel. There are three rows of animals, with the outer row featuring armored horses. The carousel is illuminated by approximately 1,200 white lights at night with 80 melodies recorded from an original band organ.

properties.name: The Obelisk
properties.description: Posted by Baostar71 Fortune Drive Irvine CA, 92618 This 50-foot high fiber optic wonder is an impressive display of ancient shape and modern technology. During the evening hours, the needle rhythmically fades from one color to another, changing shades and hues. In daylight, it is a gleaming white beacon to all who look on. It is the identifying feature of the Irvine Spectrum and is located on the northern corner near the 5 freeway.

properties.name: The last days of summer
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  The Commons at Woodbury had it\'s grand opening last weekend. The club house and recreational areas offer many amenities to residents and guests. There\'s a Lagoon Pool and Children\'s Water Garden that\'s pretty nice. We spend the day lounging by the pool and enjoying the sunny weather.

properties.name: This is your spot
properties.description: Posted by BaostarPoppy Avenue, Corona Del Mar, CAThis is your favorite spot, known locally as "Little Corona" (to distinguish it from nearby Corona del Mar State Park or "Big Corona"). You took a photo of it and framed it for me. Cormorants and other birds have claimed easily distinguishable Arch Rock as their own here.

properties.name: Turtle Fountain
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  This fountain is located outside the food court at the Irvine Spectrum. It has a diamond-shaped, flower petals design and intermittently shoots jets of water up from the ground. Kids love to skip and jump around it and get themselves all soak and wet after a few minutes.

properties.name: Unfinished Work
properties.description: Posted by BaostarIrvine, CAA whiteboard with scribblings on it that was taken from Exodus and is now sitting in my garage.

properties.name: Where we ate ice cream like we stole it
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  The biggest 1st birthday of the year for Brock. There were entertainers, caterers, milkshake jerks, an all-expense-paid ice cream truck in the driveway - perfect for the 110 degrees weather we\'ve been having in California.

properties.name: Where we got fresh lemonade
properties.description: Posted by BaostarLos Rios St, San Juan Capistrano, CAThis is where we stopped for fresh lemonade near Los Rios Street in SJC.

properties.name: Where we watched fireworks
properties.description: Posted by Baostar   Laguna Niguel, CAWhere we watched fireworks on the 4th of July and had a block party at Mike\'s house.

properties.name: Yale street ends at a meadow
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  I like to take this path home whenever I\'m driving north from the Yale loop. Yale street is shady and peaceful as you go through the old and new Northwood neighborhoods. Yale street ends at Meadowood Park, where you get a nice view of the foothills, especially during an sunset. Follow it west and it leads you into the Meadowood entrance of the community where I live.
